\93\91Go free, Ellen,\92 said he with tears in his eyes, \91Return to your home trusting in Jesus, for he will 
159
not withhold his love from any true seeker.\92 He then prayed earnestly for me, and it seemed that God would certainly regard the prayer of this saint, even if my humble petitions were unheard. My mind was much relieved, and the wretched slavery of doubt and fear departed as I listened to the wise and tender counsel of this teacher in Israel. I left his presence comforted and encouraged.
